title: ICE: 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1' for println! and writeln!

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
rustc crash:

I tried this code:

``` rust
fn main() {
    let a = 5;
    let b = 7;

    println!("{valuea} {valueb}", valuea=a, valuec=b);
}
```

I expected to see this happen: 

```
error: there is no argument named `valueb`
```

Instead, this happened: <explanation>

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic 
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. 
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports 
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace 
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 1 but the index is 1', ../src/libcollections/vec.rs:1245
stack backtrace:
```
